title: Italian Invasion of Egypt
description: Marshal Graziani's Italian Tenth Army crosses from Libya into Egypt, advancing 60 miles to Sidi Barrani before halting. This marks the beginning of the North African Campaign.

title: Operation Compass Begins
description: General O'Connor's Western Desert Force launches a surprise offensive against Italian positions at Sidi Barrani. Originally planned as a five-day raid, it becomes a stunning victory.

title: Fall of Tobruk
description: Australian 6th Division captures the vital port of Tobruk from Italian forces, taking 25,000 prisoners. The port becomes crucial for supply operations.

title: Battle of Beda Fomm
description: British forces trap and destroy the Italian Tenth Army at Beda Fomm, capturing 130,000 prisoners. The Italians are driven from Cyrenaica in just two months.

title: Rommel Arrives in Africa
description: Generalleutnant Erwin Rommel arrives in Tripoli with the first elements of what will become the Afrika Korps, tasked with preventing an Italian collapse.

title: Rommel's First Offensive
description: Against orders to remain defensive, Rommel launches his first offensive at El Agheila, catching the weakened British forces off guard and beginning the legend of the Desert Fox.

title: Siege of Tobruk Begins
description: Rommel's forces bypass Tobruk and surround it, beginning a 241-day siege. The predominantly Australian garrison refuses to surrender, earning the nickname 'Rats of Tobruk.'

title: Capture of British Generals
description: During Rommel's advance, Generals O'Connor and Neame are captured when their staff car runs into German forces at night. Britain loses its most experienced desert commander.

title: Operation Brevity
description: British attempt to relieve Tobruk fails after initial gains at Halfaya Pass. The pass becomes known as 'Hellfire Pass' due to the deadly German 88mm guns.

title: Operation Battleaxe
description: Major British offensive to relieve Tobruk ends in failure. German 88mm guns destroy 91 British tanks in three days. General Wavell is replaced by General Auchinleck.

title: SAS Founded
description: Captain David Stirling, recovering from a parachute accident, presents his plan for a small raiding force directly to General Auchinleck. L Detachment, Special Air Service Brigade is born.

title: First SAS Raid
description: The SAS's first operation is a disaster when 55 men parachute into a sandstorm. Only 21 survive. Despite this failure, the unit is not disbanded.

title: Operation Crusader Begins
description: The Eighth Army launches its largest offensive yet, with over 700 tanks. The goal is to relieve Tobruk and destroy the Afrika Korps.

title: Totensonntag
description: The 'Sunday of the Dead' sees some of the fiercest tank battles of the campaign near Sidi Rezegh. Both sides suffer heavy losses in confused fighting.

title: Siege of Tobruk Lifted
description: After 241 days, the siege of Tobruk is finally broken when relieving forces link up with the garrison. Rommel is forced to retreat to El Agheila.

title: SAS Raid on Tamet and Sirte
description: Transported by the LRDG, the SAS destroys 37 aircraft on the ground at Axis airfields. Stirling's tactics are vindicated, and the unit proves its worth.

title: Rommel's Second Offensive
description: Resupplied with tanks, Rommel launches a surprise counter-offensive. The overstretched British are caught off guard and forced back to the Gazala Line.

title: Battle of Gazala Begins
description: Rommel launches Operation Venezia, swinging south around Bir Hakeim in a bold flanking maneuver against the Gazala Line.

title: Bir Hakeim Falls
description: After a heroic 16-day defense, the Free French garrison at Bir Hakeim breaks out. Their sacrifice bought precious time but couldn't prevent Rommel's victory.

title: Fall of Tobruk
description: In a stunning reversal, Rommel captures Tobruk in a single day, taking 33,000 prisoners and massive supplies. Hitler promotes him to Field Marshal on the spot.

title: First Battle of El Alamein
description: Rommel's exhausted forces reach El Alamein but are stopped by Auchinleck's defensive line. The narrow front between the sea and Qattara Depression favors the defenders.

title: Montgomery Takes Command
description: General Bernard Montgomery takes command of the Eighth Army, bringing new leadership and a determination to fight a 'set-piece' battle against Rommel.

title: Battle of Alam el Halfa
description: Rommel's last offensive attempt is defeated when Montgomery refuses to take the bait and keeps his armor on the high ground. The tide begins to turn.

title: Rommel Returns to Germany
description: Suffering from exhaustion and ill health, Rommel returns to Germany for medical treatment, leaving General Stumme in command of the Afrika Korps.

title: Second Battle of El Alamein Begins
description: At 21:40, a 1,000-gun artillery barrage signals the start of Montgomery's offensive. Operation Lightfoot begins with infantry clearing lanes through minefields.

title: Rommel Returns
description: After General Stumme dies of a heart attack, Rommel rushes back from Germany to take command of a battle already going badly for the Axis.

title: Operation Supercharge
description: Montgomery's breakthrough operation shatters the Afrika Korps. Despite Hitler's 'Victory or Death' order, Rommel begins retreating the next day.

title: Operation Torch
description: American and British forces land in Morocco and Algeria in the first major American ground operation against Germany. The Axis forces in North Africa are now caught between two armies.

title: Tobruk Recaptured
description: The Eighth Army recaptures Tobruk as Rommel's forces retreat westward. The Desert Rats enter the port they had defended for so long.

title: Fall of Tripoli
description: The Eighth Army captures Tripoli, the capital of Italian Libya. The city that Rommel had defended for two years falls to Montgomery's pursuit.

title: David Stirling Captured
description: The founder of the SAS is captured by German forces while operating behind enemy lines in Tunisia. He spends the rest of the war in Colditz.

title: Battle of Kasserine Pass
description: Rommel inflicts a humiliating defeat on inexperienced American forces at Kasserine Pass. It serves as a harsh lesson for the US Army.

title: Battle of Medenine
description: Rommel's final offensive, Operation Capri, is defeated by Montgomery's well-prepared defenses. Fifty-two German tanks are destroyed at no loss to the British.

title: Rommel Leaves Africa
description: Sick and disillusioned, Rommel leaves North Africa for the last time, handing command to General von Arnim. He will never return to the desert.

title: Axis Surrender in Tunisia
description: General von Arnim and 275,000 Axis troops surrender in Tunisia. The North African Campaign ends after nearly three years of fighting.
